memberdef.argsstring: (__dpctl_keep const DPCTLSyclDeviceRef DRef1, __dpctl_keep const DPCTLSyclDeviceRef DRef2)
memberdef.name: DPCTLDevice_AreEq

briefdescription.para: Checks if two DPCTLSyclDeviceRef objects point to the same sycl::device.

parameterdescription.para: First opaque pointer to a sycl::device.
Second opaque pointer to a sycl::device.

simplesect.para: True if the underlying sycl::device are same, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Returns a copy of the DPCTLSyclDeviceRef object.

simplesect.para: A new DPCTLSyclDeviceRef created by copying the passed in DPCTLSyclDeviceRef object.

briefdescription.para: Returns a new DPCTLSyclDeviceRef opaque object wrapping a SYCL device instance as a host device.

simplesect.para: An opaque pointer to a sycl::device created as an instance of the host device.

briefdescription.para: Returns a new DPCTLSyclDeviceRef opaque object created using the provided device_selector.

parameterdescription.para: An opaque pointer to a sycl::device_selector.

simplesect.para: Returns an opaque pointer to a SYCL device created using the device_selector, if the requested device could not be created a nullptr is returned.

briefdescription.para: Returns a vector of sub-devices partitioned from this SYCL device by affinity domain based on the domain parameter.

simplesect.para: A DPCTLDeviceVectorRef containing DPCTLSyclDeviceRef objects

memberdef.argsstring: (__dpctl_keep const DPCTLSyclDeviceRef DRef, __dpctl_keep size_t *counts, size_t ncounts)
memberdef.name: DPCTLDevice_CreateSubDevicesByCounts

briefdescription.para: Returns a vector of sub devices partitioned from this SYCL device based on the counts parameter. For each non-zero value M in the counts vector, a sub device with M compute units is created.

parameterdescription.para: Array with count compute units that need to contains in subdevices

simplesect.para: A DPCTLDeviceVectorRef containing DPCTLSyclDeviceRef objects

briefdescription.para: Returns a vector of sub devices partitioned from this SYCL device based on the count parameter. The returned vector contains as many sub devices as can be created such that each sub device contains count compute units. If the device’s total number of compute units is not evenly divided by count, then the remaining compute units are not included in any of the sub devices.

parameterdescription.para: Count compute units that need to contains in subdevices

simplesect.para: A DPCTLDeviceVectorRef containing DPCTLSyclDeviceRef objects

briefdescription.para: Deletes a DPCTLSyclDeviceRef pointer after casting to to sycl::device.

parameterdescription.para: The DPCTLSyclDeviceRef pointer to be freed.

briefdescription.para: Returns the backend for the device.

simplesect.para: A DPCTLSyclBackendType enum value representing the sycl::backend for the device.

briefdescription.para: Returns the DPCTLSyclDeviceType enum value for the DPCTLSyclDeviceRef argument.

simplesect.para: The DPCTLSyclDeviceType value corresponding to the device.

briefdescription.para: Returns the OpenCL software driver version as a C string.

simplesect.para: A C string in the form major_number.minor.number that corresponds to the OpenCL driver version if this is a OpenCL device.
Returns the valid result if device exists else returns 0.
Returns the maximum height of a 2D image or 1D image in pixels. The minimum value is 8192 if the SYCL device has aspect::image.
Returns the maximum width of a 2D image or 1D image in pixels. The minimum value is 8192 if the SYCL device has aspect::image.
Returns the maximum depth of a 3D image The minimum value is 2048 if the SYCL device has aspect::image.
Returns the maximum height of a 3D image The minimum value is 2048 if the SYCL device has aspect::image.
Returns the maximum width of a 3D image in pixels. The minimum value is 2048 if the SYCL device has aspect::image.
Returns the valid result if device exists else returns 0.
Returns the valid result if device exists else returns 0.
Returns the valid result if device exists else returns 0.
Returns the maximum number of simultaneous image objects that can be read from by a kernel. The minimum value is 128 if the SYCL device has aspect::image.
Returns the valid result if device exists else returns 0.
Returns the valid result if device exists else returns 0.
Returns the valid result if device exists else returns NULL.
Returns the maximum number of simultaneous image objects that can be written to by a kernel. The minimum value is 8 if the SYCL device has aspect::image.

briefdescription.para: Returns a C string for the device name.

simplesect.para: A C string containing the OpenCL device name.
Returns an opaque pointer to the parent device for a sub-device, or nullptr otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Returns the sycl::platform for the device as DPCTLSyclPlatformRef opaque pointer.

simplesect.para: An opaque pointer to the sycl::platform for the device.
Returns the preferred native vector width size for built-in scalar types that can be put into vectors.
Returns the preferred native vector width size for built-in scalar types that can be put into vectors.
Returns the preferred native vector width size for built-in scalar type.
Returns the preferred native vector width size for built-in scalar types that can be put into vectors.
Returns the preferred native vector width size for built-in scalar types that can be put into vectors.
Returns the preferred native vector width size for built-in scalar types that can be put into vectors.
Returns the preferred native vector width size for built-in scalar types that can be put into vectors.
Returns true if the device supports independent forward progress of sub-groups with respect to other sub-groups in the same work-group.

briefdescription.para: Returns a C string corresponding to the vendor name.

simplesect.para: A C string containing the OpenCL device vendor name.
True if sycl::device has device::aspect, else false.
Returns hash value.

briefdescription.para: Returns true if this SYCL device is an OpenCL device and the device type is sycl::info::device_type::accelerator.

simplesect.para: True if the device type is an accelerator, else False.

briefdescription.para: Returns true if this SYCL device is an OpenCL device and the device type is sycl::info::device_type::cpu.

simplesect.para: True if the device type is a cpu, else False.

briefdescription.para: Returns true if this SYCL device is an OpenCL device and the device type is sycl::info::device_type::gpu.

simplesect.para: True if the device type is a gpu, else False.

briefdescription.para: Returns true if this SYCL device is a host device.

simplesect.para: True if the device is a host device, else False.

briefdescription.para: Returns True if the device and the host share a unified memory subsystem, else returns False.

simplesect.para: Boolean indicating if the device shares a unified memory subsystem with the host.

detaileddescription.para: This header declares a C interface to sycl::device. Not all of the device API is exposed, only the bits needed in other places like context and queue interfaces.
